pageproperties-extension-desc: Allows to easily edit display title, language and content model of a page. To associate semantic properties to pages (provided that Semantic MediaWiki is installed), and to set arbitrary SEO meta tags for the entire wiki or specific pages
pageproperties-form-language-help: type a letter to scroll the select there
pageproperties-form-meta_entire_wiki-lab: apply to entire wiki (set values can be overwritten from other pages)
pageproperties-form-publish_as-help: attribution used for links from external pages
pageproperties-form-published-help: If unselected the page is considered a draft and will be not visible to regular visitors
pageproperties-form-meta_subpages-label: Sub-pages (apply to pages inlcuded in this page)
pageproperties-form-meta_subpages-help_: Select to let subpages inherit these values
pageproperties-form-section-SEO-label: Here you can set arbitrary metadata for this page and its subpages. If the extension WikiSEO is installed, you can use the related parameters without the need to annotate them manually on the page.
pageproperties-form-section-main-label-e: Here you can set arbitrary metadata for this page, its subpages and even the entire wiki. If the extension WikiSEO is installed, you can use the related parameters without the need to annotate them manually on the page.
pageproperties-form-section-semantic-pro: Here you can set all semantic properties which aren't already annotated in the page (those annotated in the page, manually or through a template, will take the precedence to avoid inconsistencies). The "predefined" optgroup contains the allowed annotable special properties. Same properties can be used multiple times.

Here you can set semantic properties withot having to manually annotate them on the page, and where they are not being inserted by forms. Attention: properties set here will override the values of the same properties set through forms or annotations!
